definitions: To flow in streams or drops.
To melt or burn away imperfectly or unsteadily.
To provide with a gutter or gutters.
To cut gutters into (a road) for drainage.
To make (a bowling ball) go into the gutter.
To make a low, guttural sound.
examples: The candle began to gutter as the wax melted.
The street was guttered to improve drainage.
He guttered the bowling ball again.
The dog guttered a warning growl.
